intro: Trichocladus verticillatus, commonly known as the spiral moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and the presence of a central strand of cells in its stem. The leaves are elongated, often curved, and arranged in a spiral pattern around the stem, giving the plant its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate regions. Trichocladus verticillatus plays a role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its native habitats.
